articleContent.title: Scale: Major in G# (Mode: Ionian)
articleContent.content:
# G# Major Scale (Ionian Mode)

The G# Major scale is a diatonic scale composed of the notes G#, A#, B#, C#, D#, E#, and F##. It is commonly referred to as the Ionian mode and is the first mode of the major scale. In the key of G#, the G# Major scale follows a whole step - whole step - half step - whole step - whole step - whole step - half step pattern.

## Intervals in G# Major Scale
- G# to A# (Major 2nd)
- G# to B# (Major 3rd)
- G# to C# (Perfect 4th)
- G# to D# (Perfect 5th)
- G# to E# (Major 6th)
- G# to F## (Major 7th)

## Flavor and Usage
The G# Major scale has a bright and uplifting sound due to the half steps it contains. This scale is commonly used in various genres of music like pop, rock, classical, and jazz. It provides a sense of resolution and is often used in creating harmonious and melodic musical pieces.

## Songs in G# Major
1. **"Don't Stop Believin'" by Journey**: This popular rock anthem features the G# Major scale prominently in its main melody and chord progressions.
  
2. **"Hello" by Adele**: The soulful ballad "Hello" by Adele is in the key of G# Major, showcasing the emotional depth of this scale.
  
3. **"Viva la Vida" by Coldplay**: Coldplay's hit song "Viva la Vida" incorporates the G# Major scale in its uplifting and anthemic arrangement.
